response: Addition is the process of calculating the sum of two or more numbers.
Subtraction is the process of finding the difference between two numbers.
Multiplication is the process of calculating the product of two or more numbers.
Division is the process of calculating the quotient of two numbers.
Squaring a number means multiplying it by itself.
The square root of a number is a value that, when multiplied by itself, gives the original number.
Raising a number to a power means multiplying it by itself a specified number of times.
The factorial of a number is the product of all positive integers less than or equal to that number.
Modulo operation returns the remainder when one number is divided by another.
The logarithm of a number is the power to which a base must be raised to produce that number.
The sine of an angle is the ratio of the length of the opposite side to the hypotenuse in a right-angled triangle.
The cosine of an angle is the ratio of the length of the adjacent side to the hypotenuse in a right-angled triangle.
The tangent of an angle is the ratio of the sine to the cosine of that angle.
Percent is a way of expressing a number as a fraction of 100.
Area is the amount of space inside a shape, calculated based on its dimensions.
Perimeter is the total distance around the outside of a shape.
Volume is the amount of space occupied by a 3D object.
An equation is a statement that two expressions are equal, containing one or more variables.
Integration is a mathematical operation used to find the area under a curve or the accumulation of quantities.
Derivatives measure how a function changes as its input changes.
Solving an equation means finding the values of variables that make the equation true.
Factoring means breaking down an expression into simpler parts that multiply together.
A linear equation is an equation in which the variables appear only to the first power and are not multiplied together.
A quadratic equation is a second-degree polynomial equation of the form axÂ² + bx + c = 0.
A system of equations is a set of two or more equations that share common variables.
A matrix is a rectangular array of numbers arranged in rows and columns.
The determinant is a scalar value that can be computed from the elements of a square matrix.
Transposing a matrix means swapping its rows and columns.
Absolute value refers to the distance a number is from zero on the number line, without considering its sign.
An angle is the figure formed by two rays that share a common endpoint called the vertex.
Pi is the ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter, approximately equal to 3.14159.
E is Euler's number, a fundamental constant in mathematics, approximately equal to 2.71828.
A series is the sum of the terms of a sequence.
A sequence is an ordered list of numbers, where each term is generated based on a specific rule.
A combination is a selection of items from a larger set, where the order of selection does not matter.
A permutation is an arrangement of items from a larger set, where the order of selection matters.
The mean is the average of a set of numbers, calculated by summing them and dividing by the number of values.
The median is the middle value of a set of numbers when arranged in order.
The mode is the value that appears most frequently in a set of numbers.
Variance measures the spread of numbers in a dataset, indicating how far each number is from the mean.
Standard deviation is the square root of variance, representing the dispersion of a dataset.
